About Importing Archives

Importing archives gives you the ability to access existing archives and use them in projects. While it provides a similar function as copying versioned files and projects, importing archives provides other functions that copying does not. When you import archives, Version Manager automatically creates a versioned file that references the new archive.

When importing archives into Version Manager projects, you can import individual files, a single directory, or an entire directory tree to a project database, project, or subproject. You can also import archives into a 5.3/6.0 project or folder, but you cannot import archives into 5.3/6.0 project roots. You can add individual archives or a directory of archives. When importing a directory of 5.3/6.0 archives, Version Manager only imports the archives located at the root level of the directory; it does not import archives located in subdirectories.

Importing archives provides a method of:

  • Accessing archives created in a command-line interface only environment.
  • Re-creating versioned files that have been deleted.
  • Accessing all of the archives within an archive directory.
  • Restoring the reference between a versioned file and its archive when the archive is moved. For more information on how to restore the reference between a versioned file and its archive, see importing archives after moving the location.

For more information on importing archives, see the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager User's Guide.
